li.a: ← Part 7 : Add Google Analytics to your app

w:HTMLPanel.p: In this tutorial, we will will add the ajax bot plugin allowing our app (from Part 7 : Add Google Analytics to your app) to be indexed by the search engine bots.
w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Step 1 : Add the dependency in the build script
w:HTMLPanel.p: Simply add the following dependency in the build.gradle file :
w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Step 2 : Add the servlet filter
w:HTMLPanel.p: In order to add the filter, it's very easy ! simply add the following to the web.xml :

c:StaticCode.pre: <filter> <filter-name>ajax-bot-indexing-filter</filter-name> <description>Filter making passible to render ajax page as HTML.</description> <filter-class>fr.putnami.pwt.ajaxbot.AjaxBotIndexingFilter</filter-class> <init-param> <param-name>cacheFolder</param-name> <!-- Use a valid temp file --> <param-value>/tmp/cacheRenderedAjaxPage</param-value> <description>Rendered html cache folder</description> </init-param> <init-param> <param-name>cacheResetOnStartup</param-name> <param-value>true</param-value> <description>Clear the html cache on server startup</description> </init-param> </filter> <filter-mapping> <filter-name>ajax-bot-indexing-filter</filter-name> <url-pattern>*</url-pattern> </filter-mapping>

w:HTMLPanel.p: You can go to http://localhost:8080/putnami-pwt-tutorial/?_escaped_fragment_=About to watch it
You'll find detailed informations about this plugin in the plugin doc.
w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: That's it !
w:HTMLPanel.p: You have created a very nice app using PWT.
There are a lot of other very nice components described in the Components doc.
Now you can build your own app using PWT and be incredibly productive with GWT !
We hope to see you soon.
